result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Karissa Marie Clausen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 2 in Deferred Judgment of Convictioin.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 1, 2016.
Probation may be transferred.
Court authorized release of Defendant's property.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Random and regular testing.
-Testify truthfully in Mr. Rauseo-Jasperson's case.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
filed by ADA Edward Minser. eif

-Absolute Sobriety, zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Luke R.J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz DF: Karissa Marie Clausen appeared. Case called at 10:20. State files an amended information adding CT. 4 and 5. ADA Minser updates the court there is a deferred agreement on Ct. 2. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2, 4 and 5 in 15CF450. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. A Compas was not completed. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and withhold the entry of the judgment Court signs agreement. Court finds the DE guilty of Ct 4 and 5 in 15CF450. Sentencing arguments. DE has completed an assessment. DE makes a statement. Court orders on Ct. 4 and 5: Sentence W/H 
1 year probation on Ct. 4 with conditions:
- 60 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED.
- AODA and any recommended follow through
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Costs 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random and reqular testing. 
- Testify truthfully in Mr. Rauseo- Jasperson case.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- 80 hours community service. 

Ct. 5 -2 years probation  
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.  
- Costs
  Court notes 2 days credit against any ultimate sentence

DE to report to probation today and court does not object to probation being transferred.  Court authorizes release of DE personal property.
Final pre-trial at 03-01-2016 10:15 am
Final pre-trial at 02-23-2016 10:30 am

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser. Investigator Jim Mikla. DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz and DF ATTY: Joe Caton DF: Karissa Marie Clausen appeared. DF: Luke Steven Rauseo-Jasperson. Case called at 11:34. Includes 15CF450, 15CF451. S/T Investigator Jim Mikla. Direct by ADA Minser. Investigator Mikla identifies DE Luke Rauseo-Jasperson and DE Karissa Clausen in court. Cross by Atty. Schlitz. Cross by Atty. Caton. Court questions Investigator Mikla. Redirect by ADA Minser. Recross by Atty. Schlitz.   Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed on 15CF450 and 15CF451 and the DF's probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Address confirmed. Atty. Schlitz questions the hold on the car and it's contents. Court would like Atty. Schlitz and ADA Minser to stipulate on the release of the car and certain contents.  Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 11:00 am.
